metadata.description: Curated W1 ore sources for Bible mnemonic image generation
metadata.notes: Canonical W1 ore sources for Bible mnemonic image generation. 275 total sources (187 from ore-fragments + 113 from ore-fragments-generated, deduplicated). Audit completed 2025-12-27.

available.key_moment: Scholar obsessively counting creatures, finding patterns everywhere he looks

available.description: Old Murch questioning everything; skeptic at Twenty-Ten Coffee Shop; what can we really know
available.key_moment: Old man at coffee shop asking questions no one wants to answer

available.description: Notebook of skeptical observations; fragments and doubts; margins filled with questions
available.key_moment: Pages covered in scribbled doubts, crossed-out conclusions, unanswered questions

available.description: How the Form Library is organized; regions for different types of forms; navigation of infinite space
available.key_moment: Scholar describing infinite library with forms arranged by type, creature, region

available.description: Critics of Form Library hypothesis; debate between schools; what evidence would prove it
available.key_moment: Scholars arguing about existence of forms, neither able to prove their position

available.description: Forms near dens boundary; library access unstable; creatures reading wrong forms
available.key_moment: Creature at boundary reading mixed forms, becoming hybrid of multiple patterns

available.description: Erris Pol's personal notebook; marginal notes; doubts and breakthroughs; midnight thoughts
available.key_moment: Philosopher writing by candlelight, struck by sudden understanding

available.description: Pell Anster's TAME taxonomy; classifying creatures by interaction capacity not anatomy
available.key_moment: Chart showing creatures arranged by how they respond, not what they look like

available.description: Which creatures can be influenced; Maw Beast unpersuadable; cave bats trainable; Yeller unknown
available.key_moment: Trapper attempting to redirect Maw Beast, failing completely, barely escaping

available.description: Jackson as unclassifiable in mind hierarchy; responding to nothing and everything; presence without persuadability
available.key_moment: Man at fountain neither persuading nor being persuaded, simply present

available.description: Pell Anster writing to Archon Prebel; connecting mind hierarchy to spatial philosophy
available.key_moment: Letter connecting two theories, scholars beginning to see same reality

available.description: How creatures inherit forms; not genetic, not taught; something else passing between generations
available.key_moment: Offspring accessing pattern that no living creature could have taught it

available.description: Colonies remembering what individuals cannot; design persisting across complete population turnover
available.key_moment: New diggers building tunnels matching centuries-old design they've never seen

available.description: Memory as form access; forgetting as losing library card; forms persisting after creatures forget
available.key_moment: Creature that has forgotten its own form, shape degrading without pattern access

available.description: Signal as external pattern source; bodies as receivers not transmitters; healing as tuning
available.key_moment: Healer adjusting something invisible, creature's form stabilizing in response

available.description: Healer writing to philosopher; connecting field observations to theoretical framework
available.key_moment: Two distant scholars realizing they describe same phenomenon differently

available.description: Proposal to create synthetic creatures; what could they access; experiment design
available.key_moment: Scholars proposing to build creatures from scratch to test Form Library

available.description: Synthetic creatures exhibiting unprogrammed behavior; accessing forms their makers didn't give them
available.key_moment: Synthetic creature suddenly grouping in fives, behavior never taught or programmed

available.description: Where synthetic behavior comes from; creatures reading library forms not given by makers
available.key_moment: Creator watching synthetic follow patterns from nowhere, frightened by implications

available.description: Moral questions about creating creatures; do synthetics have souls; what do we owe them
available.key_moment: Scholars debating whether their creations deserve moral consideration

available.description: Same phenomenon meaning different things to different observers; multiple valid readings
available.key_moment: Three observers describing same creature, all descriptions accurate, none complete

available.description: How observer's framework determines what they can see; access levels to phenomenon
available.key_moment: Scholar realizing their framework blinds them to what another framework reveals

available.description: Prebel's discovery that observation affects outcome; observer selecting which reality manifests
available.key_moment: Scholar observing, reality collapsing into one possibility from many

available.description: Letters between Capital philosopher and Densmok practitioner; different frameworks, same truth
available.key_moment: Two scholars from different traditions recognizing same underlying reality

available.description: Horizons at different scales; cell horizon vs city horizon; nested cognition
available.key_moment: Diagram showing nested horizons from cell to creature to colony to city

available.description: Horizons contracting near dens; creatures caring about less and less; eventual cessation
available.key_moment: Creature's horizon shrinking until it cares about nothing, stops moving, dissolves

available.description: Dens boundary affecting horizons; creatures at edge losing coherent caring; mixed horizons
available.key_moment: Creature at boundary with horizon flickering, caring about incompatible things

available.description: I-C-∫ framework; levels of agency from reactive to anticipatory; how collectives scale
available.key_moment: Chart showing agency levels, individual and collective examples at each level

available.description: Archive thinking through archivists; documents as memory; procedures as habits; building as body
available.key_moment: Archivists moving through stacks as Archive's thoughts moving through Archive's mind

available.description: Moral obligations to collectives; if collectives are agents, do they have rights
available.key_moment: Philosopher arguing that destroying Archive is murder of collective mind

available.description: Limits of ingression theory; what forms cannot manifest; the unspeakable patterns
available.key_moment: Scholar gesturing at something that cannot be described, only pointed toward

available.description: Vornis Keth and Erris Pol attempting synthesis; resonance meets forms; unified Densworld theory
available.key_moment: Two scholars at table with papers spread, attempting to unify competing frameworks

available.description: Creatures as readers of forms; what happens during reading; forms changed by being read
available.key_moment: Creature accessing form, form shifting slightly as it is read, never same twice

available.description: Lurra Venn correspondence; developing individual signature analysis; what careers reveal
available.key_moment: Scholar developing method to read life patterns from sequence of career events

available.description: Burnout Arc, Slow Climb, Eternal Student, Accidental Expert; patterns in lives
available.key_moment: Chart showing four career paths, some rising, some falling, some circling forever

available.description: Bagbu challenging archetype framework; what the model misses; lives that don't fit
available.key_moment: Critic pointing at chart showing where model fails, careers that escape classification

available.description: Skeptical assessment of Capital's provenance claims; what can really be known about origins
available.key_moment: Scholar questioning whether any provenance claim can be verified

available.description: Skeptical assessment of Pattern Book predictions; what the failures reveal
available.key_moment: List of Pattern Book predictions that failed, organized by type of failure

available.description: Can maps predict? Skeptical view of Capital cartography claims
available.key_moment: Map that predicted wrong, terrain that defied the lines drawn for it

available.description: Are Capital's 'simulated citizens' real models or just stories? Skeptical analysis
available.key_moment: Scholar questioning whether simulation tells us anything about real citizens

available.description: Autonomous expedition claims assessed; what explorers without oversight really find
available.key_moment: Explorer returning with report that contradicts Capital's expectations

available.description: Response to skeptics; Capital methods defended; what the critics miss
available.key_moment: Counter-argument showing what skeptics ignore in their critique

available.description: Skeptics respond to defense; continuing debate; neither side yielding
available.key_moment: Debate continuing, positions hardening, truth somewhere between

available.description: Skeptic questioning own skepticism; has doubt become dogma; what if Capital is right
available.key_moment: Skeptic in moment of doubt about own doubting, questioning the questioning

available.description: Productive vs destructive doubt; what skepticism accomplishes; limits of questioning
available.key_moment: Essay on when to doubt and when to accept, neither easy

available.description: How to assess technical claims; methodology for skeptical evaluation
available.key_moment: Checklist for evaluating claims, systematic doubt made method

available.description: Pollus Brent's prediction log; which Pattern Book predictions worked; which failed
available.key_moment: Log showing pattern of successes and failures, pattern within pattern

available.description: Apprentice trapper learning rules; mistakes and lessons; folk knowledge acquired slowly
available.key_moment: Young trapper making mistake, nearly dying, learning rule the hard way

available.description: Collaborative treatise on creature grammar; multiple authors; attempts at synthesis
available.key_moment: Multiple scholars contributing to single document, ideas overlapping

available.description: Pollus Brent's final preface to Pattern Book; what he learned; what remains unknown
available.key_moment: Old scholar writing final preface, acknowledging limits of life's work

available.description: Career patterns in Densmok specifically; how margin town shapes lives differently
available.key_moment: Chart showing Densmok careers diverging from Capital patterns

available.description: What individual signature analysis can and cannot tell; appropriate applications
available.key_moment: Honest assessment of method's limits by its developer

available.description: Meck Drune rejecting classification; manifesto against being sorted; refusal of archetype
available.key_moment: Individual refusing to fit any category, insisting on uniqueness

available.description: Traders Guild responding to classification of their careers; practical objections
available.key_moment: Guild members arguing their work resists the model applied to it

available.description: Pollus Brent writing to Mathematical Society; requesting help with prime pattern analysis
available.key_moment: Field researcher reaching out to pure mathematicians for help
